Prerequisites:
PREREQUISITE: MINIMUM GRADE OF "C" IN ACG 2001 OR
CONSENT OF INSTRUCTOR.
Course Description:
A CONTINUATION OF THE INTRODUCTION TO FINANCIAL
ACCOUNTING. TOPICS WILL INCLUDE A STUDY OF SHORT TERM
LIQUID ASSETS, LONG TERM ASSETS, AND CURRENT LIABILITIES.  PARTNERSHIP AND CORPORATE ACCOUNTING WILL ALSO BE INTRODUCED. ADDITIONAL TOPICS WILL INCLUDE THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS, AND INVESTMENTS IN STOCKS AND BONDS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
